title: nbdev-hello-world
text:
How to use
Fill me in please! Donâ€™t forget code examples:
Just a Hello World Programm, not much to see here. In the lib is an function say_hello(to) which return Hello to!

say_hello('Steffen')

'Hello Steffen!'


Also, it will display a black circle

display(SVG('<svg height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40"/></svg>'))




To do all this and to test the functions, some other libraries getting imported: from fastcore.test import * from IPython.display import display,SVG

title: Hello World!
text:
source

say_hello

 say_hello (to)

Say hello to somebody

say_hello("PrintMe")

'Hello PrintMe!'



assert say_hello("Andrea")=="Hello Andrea!"


from fastcore.test import *
test_eq(say_hello("Andrea"), "Hello Andrea!")


from IPython.display import display,SVG
display(SVG('<svg height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40"/></svg>'))
